title: Annual Income and Age
question_text: Consider the table below about annual income and age: <25,000 25,001 < $x$ <50,000 50,001 < $x$ < 100,000 100,000 < $x$ Age under 30 37 31 14 1 Age 31-50 11 36 51 23 Age over 50 8 34 45 43 Researchers surveyed working adults and asked them their yearly income and age. Based on this table, which of the following statements is true?

choices.text: About 36 % 36 % of people surveyed are between 31 and 50 years old.
According to this chart, I have about a 10.8 % 10.8 % chance of randomly finding, among working adults, a 31-50-year-old who earns between $ 25,001 $ 25,001 to $ 50,000 $ 50,000 per year.
A segmented bar graph would be an appropriate way to display this data.
It appears from this data that older people earn more money.
